newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ING says Dutch IT outperformance is probably over.
newsitem.headline: ING says Dutch IT outperformance is probably over.

text.p: ING Barings said on Wednesday the market outperformance of the Dutch information technology (IT) sector was probably over.
In a research report on the sector, analysts Steven Vrolijk and Eric de Graaf rated only two out of the six companies covered a 'Buy': Baan and CMG.
The other four companies -- Cap Gemini NV, Getronics, Ordina, and Simac -- were all rated a 'Hold'.
The report noted that since last October share prices in the IT sector had risen on average by 89 percent, compared with a rise of just 38 percent for the 25-share AEX index.
"From an operational point of view, there seems to be little reason to believe that the IT sector's outperformance will continue," it said.

"Measured by bottom-line growth, the sector no longer stands out. In our opinion, a longer term investment in the IT sector in general is no longer so much a guarantee for outperformance as it had been during the past eight months," the report added.
For Baan and CMG, De Graaf and Vrolijk said they had 12 month price targets of 135.00 and 41.00 guilders and estimated 12-month total returns of 17 and 12 percent respectively.
